oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Jerry Bradley interview
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is Jerry Bradley being interviewed. The recording takes place on 7/78.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jerry Bradley
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side One - (0:13) -- Interviewer asks Jerry Bradley how many artists are currently on his roster. Jerry responds that RCA currently has between 28-32. (3:04) -- Interviewer asks Jerry Bradley about RCA's recent sales. (3:26) -- Jerry Bradley joined RCA June 15th, 1970. He first joined as an executive producer. Jerry Bradley helped take over the business end of RCA since Chet Atkins decided to record and tour more often. (7:05) -- Jerry Bradley speaks about creating the idea for the Waylon & Willie album. "I gave it to Waylon and had Waylon make it better." - Jerry Bradley. (7:30) -- Jerry Bradley speaks about working with Dolly Parton. (8:10) -- Interviewer asks Jerry Bradley where he believes country music to be headed. (10:22) -- Interviewer asks about New York's ability to leave Nashville alone when making records. (11:49) -- Jerry Bradley discusses Elvis Presley's sales after his death. (13:38) -- Interviewer asks about Chet Atkins' current involvement in RCA's business. (14:22) -- Jerry Bradley discusses when he became the head of RCA's Nashville operation. (14:58) -- Interviewer asks Jerry Bradley about his listening habits. (15:35) -- Interviewer asks about Jerry Bradley's current staff at Nashville's RCA division.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Bradley, Jerry
